newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: CRICKET-RAJA SAYS CRICKET CAN SMOOTH INDIA-PAKISTAN TIES.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-RAJA SAYS CRICKET CAN SMOOTH INDIA-PAKISTAN TIES.

text.p: Pakistan captain Rameez Raja said on Monday that cricket could promote better ties between his country and India.

"I think our tour will further promote friendly ties besides promoting cricket," Raja said before his team left Lahore for New Delhi for the four-nation Independence Cup, in which Sri Lanka and New Zealand are also taking part.
He said a return visit by India's cricketers in September would help to establish frequent tours between the two nations, divided over Kashmir but sharing a passion for cricket.
Pakistan cancelled its last scheduled tour of India in 1991 following threats from the Hindu nationalist Shiv Sena party, but travelled to India for last year's World Cup quarter final.
